questions.question_text: What are JavaScript data types?
questions.user_answer: JavaScript has 7 primitive data types: Number, String, Boolean, Undefined, Null, Symbol, and BigInt.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of 'this' in JavaScript?
questions.user_answer: 'this' refers to the context in which a function is called, often pointing to the object that invoked the method.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is not a valid JavaScript data type?
questions.user_answer: Integer

questions.question_text: How do you declare a function in JavaScript?
questions.user_answer: A function can be declared using the 'function' keyword followed by the function name, parameters, and body.

questions.question_text: Explain the concept of closures in JavaScript.
questions.user_answer: A closure is a function that has access to its own scope, the scope in which it was created, and the global scope.

questions.question_text: What is Node.js?
questions.user_answer: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime environment that allows you to run JavaScript code outside of the browser, often used for building backend services.

questions.question_text: What is the role of Express.js in Node.js?
questions.user_answer: Express.js is a framework built on top of Node.js to simplify the creation of server-side applications by providing useful tools for routing, middleware, etc.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a method to handle GET requests in Express.js?
questions.user_answer: app.get()

questions.question_text: How do you handle errors in Express.js?
questions.user_answer: You can use middleware functions in Express.js to handle errors by passing the error to the next middleware with 'next(err)'.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the 'next()' function in Express.js?
questions.user_answer: The 'next()' function passes control to the next middleware function in the stack.

questions.question_text: What is React and why is it used?
questions.user_answer: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, primarily for single-page applications where data changes dynamically.

questions.question_text: What is JSX in React?
questions.user_answer: JSX is a syntax extension for JavaScript that allows you to write HTML-like code within JavaScript.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is used to pass data to a React component?
questions.user_answer: props

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of React state?
questions.user_answer: State in React is used to store dynamic data that affects the rendering of components.

questions.question_text: What are React hooks?
questions.user_answer: React hooks are functions that allow you to use state and other React features in functional components.

questions.question_text: What is Vue.js?
questions.user_answer: Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework used for building user interfaces and single-page applications.

questions.question_text: How do you bind data to an element in Vue.js?
questions.user_answer: In Vue.js, you can bind data to an element using the 'v-bind' directive.

questions.question_text: What are Vue.js directives?
questions.user_answer: Vue.js directives are special attributes that apply reactive behavior to elements in the DOM.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the 'v-for' directive in Vue.js?
questions.user_answer: The 'v-for' directive is used to render a list of items by iterating over an array or object.

questions.question_text: What is Angular?
questions.user_answer: Angular is a platform and framework for building client-side applications using TypeScript and HTML.

questions.question_text: What is the difference between Angular and React?
questions.user_answer: Angular is a complete framework, while React is a JavaScript library focused mainly on building UIs.

questions.question_text: What are Angular services used for?
questions.user_answer: Angular services are used to organize and share code across components, providing business logic or data management.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is used to create a new component in Angular?
questions.user_answer: ng generate component

questions.question_text: What is the role of the 'ngOnInit' lifecycle hook in Angular?
questions.user_answer: 'ngOnInit' is a lifecycle hook that is called after Angular initializes the component, useful for initializing component properties.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are Angular directives?
What are the key features of Angular?
